blogs.name: Jeremy Keith
blogs.description: Jeremy is a web developer, author and speaker. He's from Ireland originally but now lives in Brighton, England.

blogs.name: Rachel Andrew
blogs.description: Rachel is a web developer and technical writer and editor. Works for Google on the Chrome team as a staff technical writer and content lead for web.dev and developer.chrome.com.

blogs.name: Ben Myers
blogs.description: Ben is a web developer near Dallas, Texas. Known for his commitment to web accessibility, intentional inclusiveness, and unforgivable puns.

blogs.name: Sara Soueidan
blogs.description: Sara is an independent inclusive design engineer, author, speaker, and trainer based in Lebanon.

blogs.name: Paul Robert Lloyd
blogs.description: Paul is an independent designer, writer and occasional speaker based in Brighton, England.

blogs.name: Ethan Marcotte
blogs.description: Ethan is a web designer, writer, and speaker. Famously known for coining the term "Responsive Web Design".

blogs.name: Go Make Things
blogs.description: Sometimes known as the "Vanilla JS Guy", Chris Ferdinandi helps people build a simpler, faster web.

blogs.name: Robin Rendle
blogs.description: Robin is a designer and writer from the UK but now living in San Francisco.

blogs.name: Stephanie Eckles
blogs.description: Stephanie is the author of ModernCSS.dev which provides modern solutions to old CSS problems as in-depth tutorials.

blogs.name: Chris Coyier
blogs.description: Chris is a web designer and developer and his career arc is about helping you get better at those things.

blogs.name: Trys Mudford
blogs.description: Trys is a web developer. He's created tools like Utopia — (Fluid Responsive Design).

blogs.name: Kevin Powell
blogs.description: Kevin is a CSS Evangelist. He loves CSS, and wants to help new front-end devs enjoy learning it, and help seasoned vets see how great it really is.

blogs.name: Léonie Watson
blogs.description: Léonie is a Director at TetraLogical, a member of the W3C Advisory Board, and co-chair of the W3C Web Platform Working Group.

blogs.name: Zach Leatherman
blogs.description: Zach is the creator and maintainer of 11ty, an award-winning open source site generator.

blogs.name: Heydon Pickering
blogs.description: Heydon is a designer, writer, and public speaker. He is the author of Inclusive Components.

blogs.name: Remy Sharp
blogs.description: Remy is a developer, author, speaker, and founder of Left Logic.

blogs.name: Salma Alam-Naylor
blogs.description: Salma is a live streamer, software engineer, and developer educator.

blogs.name: Andy Bell
blogs.description: Andy is a designer, front-end developer and the founder of Set Studio.

blogs.name: Manuel Matuzović
blogs.description: Manuel is a front-end developer from Vienna, Austria.

blogs.name: Miriam Eric Suzanne
blogs.description: Miriam is an author, artist, developer, and open web advocate.

blogs.name: Rachel Smith
blogs.description: Rachel is a developer building software for CodePen.

blogs.name: Bruce Lawson
blogs.description: Bruce is web developer with a firm belief that the web is a revolutionary communication mechanism and should be available to all.

blogs.name: Jen Kramer
blogs.description: Jen is an award-winning instructor who teaches HTML, CSS, and coding for a living.

blogs.name: Scott Jehl
blogs.description: Scott is a designer, developer, and author of Responsible Responsive Design.

blogs.name: Jim Nielsen
blogs.description: Jim is a designer, engineer and writer. At the intersection of design & code on the web

blogs.name: Josh Collinsworth
blogs.description: Josh is a frontend developer, designer, writer, and teacher.

blogs.name: Brad Frost
blogs.description: Brad is a design system consultant, web designer, speaker, writer, and musician located in beautiful Pittsburgh, PA.

blogs.name: Jina Anne
blogs.description: Jina is a design systems advocate living in the East Bay of the San Francisco Bay Area. A designer who codes and “no-codes”.

blogs.name: Chris Heilmann
blogs.description: Chris is an engineer who worked for Microsoft/Mozilla/Yahoo on browsers, developer tools and anything JavaScript related. AI/ML enthusiast, writer and trainer.

blogs.name: Dave Rupert
blogs.description: Dave is the co-founder of Luro, lead developer at Paravel, and co-host of ShopTalk.

blogs.name: Stephanie Stimac
blogs.description: Stephanie is a designer and a product manager. She writes about the web, design, product management and little bits of life.

blogs.name: Eric A. Meyer
blogs.description: Eric has been working with the web since late 1993 and is an internationally recognised expert on the subjects of HTML, CSS, and web standards.

blogs.name: Amy Hupe
blogs.description: Amy is a content design and design systems consultant, making the case for simplicity and inclusion in the face of complexity.

blogs.name: Max Böck
blogs.description: Max is a front-end web developer and designer based in Vienna, Austria. He focusses on creating engaging, accessible & performant interfaces for humans.

blogs.name: Jason Lengstorf
blogs.description: Jason is a principal developer experience engineer at Netlify and the host of Learn With Jason.

blogs.name: Cassie Evans
blogs.description: Cassie makes fun, interactive things with code.

blogs.name: CSS { In Real Life }
blogs.description: A blog by Michelle Barker about CSS, front-end development, the web, and beyond.

blogs.name: Tantek Çelik
blogs.description: Tantek is a web standards and IndieWeb advocate, and a software engineer at Mozilla.

blogs.name: Chen Hui Jing
blogs.description: Chen Hui Jing is a self-taught front-end designer and developer who believes HTML and CSS are the foundation of the web.

blogs.name: Josh Comeau
blogs.description: Josh is a software developer, writer, and educator.

blogs.name: Rob Bowen
blogs.description: Rob is an independent creative developer from Abergavenny, South Wales.

blogs.name: Adrian Roselli
blogs.description: Adrian is a Consultant, Writer, Speaker.

blogs.name: Alex Russell
blogs.description: Alex is a Microsoft Partner PM on the Edge team and Blink API OWNER. It's his professional mission to build a web that works for everyone.

blogs.name: Ana Rodrigues
blogs.description: Ana is a frontend developer living in London.

blogs.name: Frank Chimero
blogs.description: Frank is a designer with 20 years of experience in brand, product design, and creative direction. He has an international reputation for creating warm, smart, and effective design for a variety of companies in technology and publishing.

blogs.name: Om Malik
blogs.description: Om is a San Francisco-based writer, photographer, and investor. He writes about technology, photography, and general observations about life on this website.

blogs.name: Baldur Bjarnason
blogs.description: Baldur is a writer, web developer and consultant based in Hveragerði, Iceland.

blogs.name: Dan Mcquillan
blogs.description: Dan is a Lecturer in Creative and Social Computing. He has a degree in Physics from Oxford and a PhD in Experimental Particle Physics from Imperial College, London. In the early days of the world wide web, he started a pioneering website to provide translated information for asylum seekers and refugees.
